content: quickie cuffs these easy wrist warmers work up in a snap the simple wrist warmer is decorated by a slightly ruffled shell edging cuffs are a great way to complete an outfit especially if you make them in yarn to match your favorite scarf the sample pair are worked in a slightly bulky weight cotton blend by skacel which creates a texture similar to terry cloth materials ocean by skacel collection 80 yd /50 gr ball about ½ ball or 40 yds depending on wrist size sample shown in color 10059 this pattern would also work well with encore chunky bernat softee chunky or any slightly bulky yarn us size h or i hook choose the smaller hook for less fuzzy or lighter weight yarns the larger for fuzzier or heavier yarns sample pair was worked with h hook stitches used chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet gauge is not important for this project as you will be working from measurements all work is done in rounds round most rounds with right side facing do not turn at ends of rounds except as directed specifically directions measure wrist just above bones chain the nearest multiple of 6 being careful not to twist chain join last stitch to first to form a ring round 1 chain 3 here and throughout the chain 3 counts as the first double_crochet of the round double_crochet in next 24 chain join with a slip_stitch in top of beginning chain round 2 chain 3 double_crochet in each st join rnds 3 & 4 repeat round 2 round 5 chain 1 single_crochet in back loop only of each st join with a slip_stitch in top of chain 1 round 6 chain 1 single_crochet in first st skip next 2 sts 5 double_crochet in next st skip next 2 sts single_crochet in next st repeat between around join turn round 7 wrong side is now facing chain 1 *single_crochet in next single_crochet chain 3 single_crochet in next double_crochet 5 times* repeat from * to * around join fasten_off weave in ends to finish cpyright 2008 by deborah e burger
